record_metadata.dc:creator: Digital Preservation Department / The National Archives
record_metadata.dc:description: This format is identifiable via a container signature in DROID 6 and later.

details.dc:description: An ESRI file geodatabase is a collection of files in a folder on disk that can store, query, and manage both spatial and nonspatial data.The GeoDB is the primary data storage model for ArcGIS.
details.dc:creator: Esri / Esri

record_metadata.dc:creator: Digital Preservation Department / The National Archives
record_metadata.dc:description: Unfortunately we are currently unable to use PRONOM to be able to develop a signature to identify this format, hopefully in the future this functionality will be available.

details.dc:description: SHA256 is part of the family of SHA-2 (Secure Hash Algorithm 2) hash functions which are designed by the United States National Security Agency. SHA256 prodcues a 256-but (32-byte) hash value. It can be used as a checksum to verify data integrity. The SHA256 file is a text document which contains single or multiple SHA1 values.

record_metadata.dc:creator: Digital Preservation Department / The National Archives

details.dc:description: SHA-1 (Secure Hash Algorithm 1) is a cryptographic hash function designed by the United States National Security Agency and is a U.S. Federal Information Processing Standard published by the United States NIST. SHA-1 produces a 160-bit (20-byte) hash value. It can be used as a checksum to verify data integrity. The SHA1 file is a text document which contains single or multiple SHA1 values.

record_metadata.dc:creator: Digital Preservation Department / The National Archives

details.dc:description: The MD5 algorithm is a hash function producing a 128-bit hash value, it is described in RFC 1321. Although MD5 was initially designed to be used as a cryptographic hash function, it has been found to suffer from extensive vulnerabilities. It can still be used as a checksum to verify data integrity against unintentional corruption. The MD5 file is a text document which contains single or multiple MD5 values.

record_metadata.dc:creator: Digital Preservation Department / The National Archives

signature.name: Jeffs Image Format
signature.note: JIF99a

details.dc:description: Jeff's Image Format (JIF) is a raster image file format that was designed to be a patent-free alternative to GIF. It is nearly identical to GIF, except that it uses zlib compression instead of LZW.

record_metadata.dc:creator: Digital Preservation Department / The National Archives

details.dc:description: Software-Independent Archiving of Relational Databases is a format for storing content of relational databases in files for long-term preservation e.g. in archives. The format was developed by the Swiss Federal Archives. It is an open standard and is supported by the SIARD software of the Swiss Federal Archives. SIARD format is a ZIP file (based on the 64 bit extension of the ZIP format introduced by PkWare Inc. with version 4.5 of the ZIP format definition in order to avoid size limitations which are unrealistic for databases). The ZIP file contains an XML file describing the database structure (database metadata) as well as a collection of XML files describing the table content (database primary data) as well as - optionally - some text files and some binary files representing database large objects (BLOBs and CLOBs). SIARD format is used for archiving databases adhering to the SQL (ideally SQL:1999 core) standard.
details.dc:creator: Swiss Federal Archives / Swiss Federal Archives

record_metadata.dc:creator: Keep Solutions / Keep Solutions
record_metadata.dc:description: This format is identifiable via a container signature in DROID 6 and later.

signature.name: Adobe Photoshop PSB
signature.note: BOF: '8BPS', version 2 (0x0002), 6 reserved null bytes https://www.adobe.com/devnet-apps/photoshop/fileformatashtml/

details.dc:description: Adobe Photoshop is a raster graphics editor developed and published by Adobe Systems. The Large Document Format supports documents of up to 300,000 pixels in any dimension as opposed to the PSD limit of 30,000 pixels.
details.dc:creator: Adobe Systems Incorporated

record_metadata.dc:creator: Digital Preservation Department / The National Archives

signature.name: SPSS Portable
signature.note: From the format description (http://www.gnu.org/software/pspp/pspp-dev/html_node/Portable-File-Header.html): "The first 200-byte segment is divided into five 40-byte sections, each of which represents the string charset SPSS PORT FILE in a different character set encoding, where charset is the name of the character set used in the file, e.g. ASCII or EBCDIC. Each string is padded on the right with spaces in its respective character set." The order is: EBCDIC, 7-bit ASCII, CDC 6-bit ASCII, 6-bit ASCII, Honeywell 6-bit ASCII.

details.dc:description: SPSS (Statistical Package for the Social Sciences) is a software package used for statistical analysis in the social sciences. The portable data format is designed for data transfer between differing operating systems and versions of SPSS.
details.dc:creator: IBM Corporation

record_metadata.dc:creator: Digital Preservation Department / The National Archives

details.dc:description: OpenRaster is an open exchange format for layered raster based graphics, loosely based on the Open Document standards. A specification is available: https://freedesktop.org/wiki/Specifications/OpenRaster/

record_metadata.dc:creator: Digital Preservation Department / The National Archives
record_metadata.dc:description: This format can be identified via a container signature in DROID version 6 or later. The PRONOM database cannot currently represent container signatures.

details.dc:description: Krita is a free raster graphics editor. Krita's native document format is Krita Document (.kra), which is loosely based on the Open Document standard. The format is used for handling layered raster based graphics.

record_metadata.dc:creator: Digital Preservation Department / The National Archives
record_metadata.dc:description: This format can be identified via a container signature in DROID version 6 or later. The PRONOM database cannot currently represent container signatures.

details.dc:description: TZX is a casette tape image format originally created by Tomaz Kac and used by emulators of ZX Spectrum computer systems.

record_metadata.dc:creator: Digital Preservation Department / The National Archives

signature.name: OpenEXR
signature.note: BOF: Magic 0x762F3101, version 02 http://www.openexr.com/openexrfilelayout.pdf

details.dc:description: OpenEXR is a raster image file format developed by Industrial Light and Magic for use in computer imaging applications. The published specification for OpenEXR describes version 2 of the file format. Version 1 was used internally by Industrial Light and Magic before OpenEXR was released as open source.

signature.name: Digital Speech Standard

details.dc:description: Digital Speech Standard is a proprietary audio file format for the storage of digital speech recordings, which was jointly developed and introduced by Olympus, Grundig and Philips.

record_metadata.dc:creator: Digital Preservation Department / The National Archives

signature.name: Digital Speech Standard DSS Pro
signature.note: BOF: 0x03 'DS2'

details.dc:description:
Digital Speech Standard is a proprietary audio file format for the storage of digital speech recordings, which was jointly developed and introduced by Olympus, Grundig and Philips.
The DSS Pro (.ds2) format supports improved sound quality over the original Digital Speech Standard format, and also supports file encryption.

details.dc:description: FBX is a 3D file format developed by Kaydara and owned by Autodesk since 2006. It is used to provide interoperability between 3D digital content creation applications. FBX has a text based (ASCII) and a binary version (this signature).
details.dc:creator: Autodesk Corporation

signature.name: Interlis transfer file 2.2 a
signature.note: <?xml version=('|")1.0('|") encoding=('|")UTF-8('|"){0-2}?>{0-256}<TRANSFER xmlns=('|")http://www.interlis.ch/INTERLIS2.2('|")

details.dc:description: INTERLIS is a description and transfer mechanism for spatial data. INTERLIS 2 Transfer files are XML files that contain data, e.g. geodata, which is structured according to certain rules. These rules are described in another file (or multiple files) called a model file.

record_metadata.dc:creator: Digital Preservation Department / The National Archives

signature.name: INTERLIS model file 2.2
signature.note: INTERLIS 2.2;{1-1024}MODEL

details.dc:description: INTERLIS is a description and transfer mechanism for spatial data. INTERLIS 2 Model files contain the geodata and can be converted to XML Schema (XSD) files (by using a software called INTERLIS compiler). Such models are described using a Modula-like language, which can be thought of as a superset of UML.

signature.note: BOF = SCNT and EOF = ENDE

record_metadata.dc:creator: Digital Preservation Department / The National Archives

details.dc:description: INTERLIS is a description and transfer mechanism for spatial data. INTERLIS 1 Model files contain the geodata.

signature.name: SAS Catalog (Windows) Generic
signature.note: BOF: 32 byte binary magic {7} 0x32 = Windows {116} 'CATALOG' Signature based extensively on unofficial description of DATA format, plus a wide variety of format samples: https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/sas7bdat/vignettes/sas7bdat.pdf

details.dc:description: SAS (Statistical Analysis System) is a statistical analysis software suite developed by SAS Institute. SAS catalogs store many different kinds of information in smaller units called catalog entries. Each entry has an entry type that identifies its purpose to SAS. A single SAS catalog can contain several types of catalog entries. This generic entry applies where PRONOM is unable to be specific regarding the version number of the file format. Please contact the PRONOM mailbox if you encounter a 'generic' SAS catalog file as this will help improve the data within PRONOM.

signature.name: R3D v2
signature.note: BOF, offset 4: RED2{2}R2

details.dc:description: REDCODE RAW (R3D) is a proprietary multimedia audio/video file format owned by the Red Digital Cinema Camera Company and featuring lossy compression for video contents and lossless for audio contents. It is used as native recording format of Red digital cameras and recorded on proprietary Hard Disk Drives, CompactFlash cards or SSD drives, but can be extracted from there and be trivially handled in any file-based audio/video, IT or home environments.

details.dc:description: The Redcode Metadata File stores post-production edits of the raw media files. The original files remain untouched as the RMD file records, among other adjustments, changes to colour, white-balance, and dynamic range of the original image.

signature.note: BOF: TBWP or TBTX, followed by null. TB stands for TouchBase, Symantec's original internal name for the product. WP = Word Processor including header/footer. TX = Text only. Format is described here: https://books.google.co.uk/books?id=YfkUKcyI7KIC&pg=PT439

signature.name: Q&A Write Word Processor (TX)
signature.note: BOF: TBWP or TBTX, followed by null. TB stands for TouchBase, Symantec's original internal name for the product. WP = Word Processor including header/footer. TX = Text only. Format is described here: https://books.google.co.uk/books?id=YfkUKcyI7KIC&pg=PT439

details.dc:description: Q&A was a database and word processing software program for IBM PC-compatible computers published by Symantec and partners from 1985 to 1998. Due to their age, Q&A files may lack an extension.
details.dc:creator: Symantec Corporation

record_metadata.dc:creator: Digital Preservation Department / The National Archives

signature.name: Draco
signature.note: BOF: 'DRACO', major version 1 Header defined in code: https://github.com/google/draco/blob/master/compression/config/compression_shared.h

details.dc:description: Draco is a library for compressing and decompressing 3D geometric meshes and point clouds. It is intended to provide efficient storage and transmission of 3D graphics.
details.dc:creator: Google

record_metadata.dc:creator: Digital Preservation Department / The National Archives

signature.name: Geography Markup Language 3.2
signature.note: ASCII header: <?xml version="1.0" , followed by gml namespace declaration xmlns:gml='http://www.opengis.net/gml/3.2

details.dc:description: The Geography Markup Language (GML) is the XML grammar defined by the Open Geospatial Consortium (OGC) to express geographical features. GML serves as a modeling language for geographic systems as well as an open interchange format for geographic transactions on the Internet. Version 3.2 introduced a new GML XML namespace and represents ISO standard 19136. Full specifications can be found at http://www.opengeospatial.org/standards/gml

record_metadata.dc:creator: Archaeology Data Service / Archaeology Data Service

signature.name: OGR GFS File
signature.note: BOF: <GMLFeatureClassList> EOF: </GMLFeatureClassList>

details.dc:description: The GFS file is used by the OGR Geography Markup Language reader to predefine dataset level information in the absense of an XML Schema definition for the feature classes within the GML file. Its purpose and syntax is described here: http://www.gdal.org/drv_gml.html

record_metadata.dc:creator: Archaeology Data Service / Archaeology Data Service

signature.name: 3DMF ASCII
signature.note: BOF: '3DMetafile (' https://hwiegman.home.xs4all.nl/fileformats/3dmf/3DMF.pdf

details.dc:description: 3DMF is the interchange format for the QuickDraw 3D software package originally created in 1995 for the Apple Macintosh. It is a three-dimensional image format which may be a representation of an individual object or a complete three-dimensional scene, which can be viewed from different angles with supporting 3D programs.
details.dc:creator: Apple Computer, Inc.

signature.name: Windows Journal
signature.note: BOF: 'NB*' 0x00 {4} 0x500100100200000 based on observation from a wide pool of samples

details.dc:description: JNT is the native format of Windows Journal, a notetaking application created by Microsoft for Windows operating systems starting with Windows XP. Due to security concerns Microsoft advise against using the format and have supplied a patch for removal of the application (https://support.microsoft.com/en-gb/help/3161102/update-for-windows-journal-component-removal). Microsoft also provide an update that re-installs a version of Windows Journal that highlights the security concerns (https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/help/3162655/windows-journal-application-for-windows). A JTP is a Windows Journal Template file, however this appears to be structurally identical to a JNT file.
details.dc:creator: Microsoft Corporation

signature.name: BKNAS
signature.note: BOF: 'BKNAS ' version = '1.0'

details.dc:description: BKNAS is an ASCII data format created to allow easy transfer of seismic data.

record_metadata.dc:creator: Digital Preservation Department / The National Archives

details.dc:description: Within Adobe Premiere and Adobe Audition, graphical waveform files may be created during the editing process. These are typically found alongside 'Conformed Audio' files that contain audio data. .pek files may sometimes be found to contain no data and have a size of zero bytes - PRONOM will be unable to automatically identify such files.
details.dc:creator: Adobe Systems Incorporated

record_metadata.dc:creator: National Library of Scotland / National Library of Scotland

signature.name: AVCHD Clip Information File
signature.note: BOF: HDMV0100

details.dc:description: AVCHD (Advanced Video Coding High Definition) is a file-based format for the digital recording and playback of high-definition video. The Clip Information File may be created by some AVCHD video recorders and contains metadata describing the AVCHD stream.
details.dc:creator: Sony / Sony

record_metadata.dc:creator: National Library of Scotland / National Library of Scotland

signature.name: M2TS
signature.note: BOF: offset 4, 0x47 sync byte appearing every 192 bytes from hereon. https://www.google.ch/patents/US7106946

details.dc:description: M2TS is the video stream packet format used on Blu-ray discs. M2TS is similar to fmt/585 - MPEG-2 Transport Stream, but instead features 192 byte packets, with a 4 byte TP_extra_header preceeding each 188 byte transport packet. Filenames usually take the form 'xxxxx.mts' or xxxxx.m2ts' where xxxxx represents a numeric value, beginning with 00000 and incrementing by 1 for each stream.
details.dc:creator: Sony / Sony

record_metadata.dc:creator: National Library of Scotland / National Library of Scotland

record_metadata.dc:creator: Historic Environment Scotland / Historic Environment Scotland

signature.name: Phase One IIQ Raw
signature.note: BOF: II*.{4}IIIICwaR

details.dc:description: Phase One is a camera manufacturer and Capture One is the accompanying software. This format contains the raw image data captured by the camera's image sensor. IIQ stands for Intelligent Image Quality, a compressed version of the raw image data captured by Phase One camera equipment. IIQ has a choice of a 'Large' (lossless) or 'Small' (lossy) options. With further research it may be possible to distinguish between these outputs.

signature.name: AVCHD Movie Object File

signature.name: AVCHD Index File
signature.note: BOF: INDX0100

signature.name: AVCHD Thumbnail Index File
signature.note: BOF: TIDX0100

details.dc:description: AVCHD (Advanced Video Coding High Definition) is a file-based format for the digital recording and playback of high-definition video. The Thumbnail Index file stores an index to AVCHD thumbails, which are JPEG files with a .tdt extension.
details.dc:creator: Sony / Sony

details.dc:description: The File Allocation Table is a file system architecture used across a range of computer systems. This entry aims to capture instances where the file system has been exported as a portable disk image. It may be possible and desirable to distinguish between different types of FAT image. Please contact the PRONOM team if you can assist with this.

record_metadata.dc:creator: National Library of Scotland / National Library of Scotland

details.dc:creator: Microsoft Corporation

record_metadata.dc:creator: National Library of Scotland / National Library of Scotland

details.dc:description: VBScript is a scripting language based on Visual Basic, developed by Microsoft. A VBScript file contains code but doesn't have a formal structure or mandatory elements that can be used by PRONOM for identification purposes.
details.dc:creator: Microsoft Corporation

record_metadata.dc:creator: National Library of Scotland / National Library of Scotland

details.dc:description: This entry aims to describe Exclude files that don't have a formal header or mandatory elements that can be used for automatic identification within PRONOM. The purpose of an Exclude file may be application-specific. In Visual Studio for example, the .exclude extension is added to files that are to be ignored or not included within a project. In this instance the extension .exclude is simply appended to the file and doesn't alter the internal structure of the file in any way.

record_metadata.dc:creator: National Library of Scotland / National Library of Scotland
